question: 子守歌
sourceMnemonic: A <kanji>song</kanji> you sing to <kanji>protect</kanji> your <kanji>child</kanji> while they sleep is called a <vocabulary>lullaby</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
The readings for this word are all kun'yomi readings. You haven't learned this reading for <ja>守</ja> yet, so here's a mnemonic to help you:

When you finish singing a <vocabulary>lullaby</vocabulary> to your child they always ask for <reading>more</reading> (<ja>もり</ja>). It doesn't matter how many you sing, they always want at least one more before they will fall asleep.
